meanings.definition: A long, wavering, high-pitched vocal sound resembling a howl or wail, often expressing grief or joy.
meanings.sent1: The ululations of the wolves echoed through the forest, signaling their presence.
meanings.sent2: The ululations of the singer captivated the audience with their emotional depth.
meanings.sent3: The ululations of the baby trying to mimic a wolf made everyone in the room chuckle.
meanings.sent4: The ululations of the wind in the night sounded like a chorus of mournful spirits.
meanings.sent5: The ululations of the grieving widow pierced the silence of the cemetery.

meanings.definition: The act of producing such a sound.
meanings.sent1: Her ululations filled the room with a haunting melody.
meanings.sent2: The ululations of the choir members blended harmoniously during the performance.
meanings.sent3: The ululations of the toddler trying to imitate a siren amused the entire family.
meanings.sent4: The ululations of the violin strings created a melancholic atmosphere in the concert hall.
meanings.sent5: The ululations of the grieving woman resonated with the sorrow of those around her.
